node.text:
Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) - https://github.com/barbeau/gpstest/blob/master/FAQ.md
*** Status View ***
• Latitude - In decimal degrees (WGS 84) • Longitude - In decimal degrees (WGS 84) • Alt - Meters above the WGS 84 ellipsoid • Alt (MSL) - Meters above Mean Sea Level (requires NMEA support) • Acc - Estimated horizontal accuracy of the location (radius in meters of 68% confidence). In other words, if you draw a circle centered at this location's latitude and longitude, and with a radius equal to the accuracy, then there is a 68% probability that the true location is inside the circle. • H/V Acc - Estimated horizontal and vertical accuracy of the location, both at the 68% confidence. Horizontal accuracy is defined the same as Acc field above. Vertical accuracy is available on Android 8.0 Oreo and higher. Vertical accuracy example - if Alt is 150, and V Acc is 20 then there is a 68% probability of the true altitude being between 130 and 170 meters. • Speed - Speed, in meters/second over ground • S. Acc - Estimated speed accuracy of this location at 68% confidence, in meters per second. For example, if Speed is 5, and Speed Acc is 1, then there is a 68% probability of the true speed being between 4 and 6 meters per second. • Bearing - The horizontal direction of travel of the device (in degrees 0-360), and is not related to the device orientation. • B. Acc - Estimated bearing accuracy of this location at 68% confidence, in degrees. For example, if Bearing is 60, and Bearing Acc is 10, then there is a 68% probability of the true bearing being between 50 and 70 degrees. • # Sats - # satellites used in fix / # satellites in view • PDOP - Position (3D) dilution of precision (requires NMEA support) • H/V DOP - Horizontal / vertical dilution of precision (requires NMEA support) • TTFF - Time to first fix • ID or PRN - identifier of this satellite (pseudorandom noise for GPS) • CF - Label (e.g., L1) for carrier frequency of signal being tracked. If an unknown frequency, it shows the raw frequency in MHz (available on Android 8.0+, but not supported on all devices) • SNR - Signal-to-noise ratio (Android M and lower) (http://bit.ly/SNR-CN0) • C/N0 - Carrier-to-noise density (Android N and higher) (http://bit.ly/SNR-CN0) • Flags - (E) if the device has ephemeris data for the satellite, (A) if the device has almanac data for the satellite, (U) if the satellite was used in the latest fix
*** Sky View ***
• GPS (USA Navstar) - Circles • GLONASS (Russia) - Squares • Galileo (European Union) - Triangles • QZSS (Japan) - Hexagons • BeiDou/COMPASS (China) - Pentagons • SBAS (WAAS, EGNOS, GAGAN, MSAS, SDCM, SNAS, SACCSA) - Diamonds
• Transparent satellites - Not in view • Thin outline - In view but not used in fix • Bold outline - Used in fix
• Expected SNR range is 0 dB (red) to 30 dB (green) on Android versions less than 7.0. • Expected SNR range is 10 dB (red) to 45 dB (green) on Android 7.0 and higher. • Expected C/N0 range is 10 dB-Hz (red) to 45 dB-Hz (green) on Android 7.0 and higher. • If there is no SNR or C/N0 value for a satellite (i.e., it is not in view of the device), it will have a transparent light gray color.
*** Acknowledgments ***
• Mike Lockwood - original developer for v1.x • Sean Barbeau - developer for v2.x and higher • GPSTest launcher icon is derived from the Android Material Design satellite icon, licensed by Google under Apache v2.0. Other Google material design icons are also used under Apache v2.0. • Chinese translation provided by wangkf, liuyunli, SakuraSa233 & Skimige • German translation provided by SIRSteiner • Dutch translation provided by Dennis Dolman • Greek translation provided by Jimmy Golfi • Japanese translation provided by SakuraSa233
